oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Accelerated power development and reform programme in India
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUKDE, PK
SATHE, DA
KULKARNI, SV
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: losses
power distribution economics
power distribution reliability
power markets
power transmission economics
power transmission reliability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper discusses power sector reforms and restructuring in India. After the initiation of economic reforms in the year 1991, the Government of India also embarked on the reforms in the power sector. Power development and reform programme scheme which has started yielding results in various region of the country. The projects funded under this scheme are aimed at: improving financial viability of state, reducing T&D loss, improving reliability and bringing transparency.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the IEEE Power Engineering Society General Meeting (V 2), Denver, USA, 6-10 June 2004, 2346-2352
